On DATE the ORG carried out a reform consisting of CARDINAL major amendments to the electoral legislation : an increase of the electoral threshold from MONEY back to MONEY , a ban on all forms of electoral blocks and coalitions and a ban on persons with dual or multiple nationality becoming members of ORG .

CARDINAL . The latter amendment to the electoral legislation ( Law no . CARDINAL ) was adopted in its first reading by ORG long before that date , on CARDINAL DATE . According to the draft law prepared by ORG , only persons having exclusively NORP citizenship were entitled to work in senior positions in the government and in several public services and be candidates in legislative elections . This provision was not applicable to persons living in GPE . In an explanatory note to the draft the Vice - Minister of ORG stated :

“ Having analysed the current situation in the country in the field of citizenship , we observe that the tendency of Moldovans to obtain citizenships of other countries is explained by their desire to obtain privileges consisting of unrestrained travel in ORG , social privileges , family reunion , employment and studies .

At the same time , persons holding other nationalities have political and legal obligations towards those states . This fact could generate a conflict of interest in cases in which there are obligations both towards GPE and towards other states , whose national a particular person is .

In view of the above , and with a view to solving the situation created , we consider it reasonable to amend the legislation in force so as to ban holders of multiple nationalities from public functions ...

This will not mean , however , that those persons will not be able to work in GPE . They will be able to exercise their professional activities in fields which do not involve the exercise of state authority ... ”

“ CARDINAL . In this respect , ORG would like to express its concern about a draft law on the modification and completion of certain legislative acts adopted in its first reading by ORG on DATE . According to this draft law , only persons having exclusively GPE citizenship are entitled to work in senior positions in the government and in several public services . From the information it has received , ORG understands that if this draft law enters into force as it stands , NORP citizens with multiple citizenship would be seriously disadvantaged compared with other NORP citizens in access to public functions . It thus appears that , if the law enters into force as such , this could lead to discrimination , i.e. unjustified differential treatment on the grounds of citizenship . ECRI understands that a wide - ranging debate is occurring within GPE at the time of writing this report as far as this draft law is concerned and that many sources both at the national and international level have stressed the need to revise the text thoroughly before its final adoption in order to ensure its compatibility with national and international standards .
